definition: to join up with sb/to become partner/to take meals regularly in cafeteria
to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]
meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together

sentences.english: Cathy is boarding with Mrs King while she's in town.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在城里时在金夫人家搭伙。

sentences.english: She found board and lodging in the house of her pupils' parents.
sentences.chinese: 她在她学生的家长家里搭伙寄宿。

sentences.english: The schoolteacher found lodging in the house of his pupils'parents.
sentences.chinese: 那教师在他学生父母家中找到搭伙及寄宿的地方。

sentences.english: Jim prefers to board with Mrs. Smith.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆更愿意在史密斯太太那儿搭伙。

sentences.english: It took us 13 hours and we were all bundled together.
sentences.chinese: 路上花了13个小时，我们搭伙在一起的。

sentences.english: The Browns will board you very cheaply.
sentences.chinese: 布朗夫妇给你搭伙，收费会很便宜。

sentences.english: Several college students boarded with the retired couple.
sentences.chinese: 几名大学生在一对退休夫妇家搭伙并寄宿。

sentences.english: Let's go and arrange with them about the board.
sentences.chinese: 咱们去和他们把搭伙的事安排一下。

sentences.english: The boy is angry, very angry.

definition: travel with another/accompany another
to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
to bring together/to make do in a bad situation/to just get by/to improvise/passable/not too bad
to go with sb/to form companionships
to freeload for food
to accept (a bit reluctantly)/to put up with
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
to travel together/thanks to
to get along well/compatible/also written 和得來|和得来[he2 de5 lai2]
to ask for help/to ask a favor/to recruit talented people
lit. to be together from the first beat (idiom)/to hit it off/to click together/to chime in easily
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
at that time (old)
to be dating sb
to disband/(of a partnership, group etc) to break up
to rent jointly with other people/co-renting
